de.esoco.lib.expression.predicate

Class ClassPredicate<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractFunction<L,O>
        • de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractBinaryFunction<L,R,java.lang.Boolean>
          • de.esoco.lib.expression.predicate.AbstractBinaryPredicate<T,java.lang.Class<?>>
            • de.esoco.lib.expression.predicate.ClassPredicate<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BinaryFunction<T,java.lang.Class<?>,java.lang.Boolean>, BinaryPredicate<T,java.lang.Class<?>>, java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Boolean>, java.util.function.Predicate<T>, Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClassPredicate.HasBaseClass, ClassPredicate.HasClass

    public abstract class ClassPredicate<T>
extends AbstractBinaryPredicate<T,java.lang.Class<?>>
    A predicate that checks the class of target objects.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ClassPredicate.HasBaseClass<T>
      A class predicate that checks whether target objects have a particular base class by invoking the Class.isAssignableFrom(Class) method on the compare class with the class to be checked as the argument.
      static class  ClassPredicate.HasClass<T>
      A class predicate that checks whether target objects have a particular class by performing an identity comparison.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface de.esoco.lib.expression.BinaryPredicate

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public final java.lang.Boolean evaluate(T rTarget,
                                        java.lang.Class<?> rClass)
        Checks if the target is not NULL and it's class is equal to the check class of this predicate.
        Parameters:
        rTarget - The left value to evaluate
        rClass - The right value to evaluate
        Returns:
        The result of the evaluation
        See Also:

      • checkClass

        protected abstract boolean checkClass(java.lang.Class<?> rCheckClass,
                                      java.lang.Class<?> rClass)
        Must be implemented by subclasses to perform the actual class check.
        Parameters:
        rCheckClass - The class of the object that is currently evaluated
        rClass - The class to check the first argument against
        Returns:
        The result of the class check
